revised_title: Selective Gene Expression in Amphibian Oocytes: Reprogramming Somatic Nuclei
tldr: This study demonstrates that somatic nuclei injected into amphibian oocytes can express their genes in a selective and biologically meaningful way. The oocyte cytoplasm reprograms the injected nuclei to conform to the oocyte pattern of gene expression, providing a valuable experimental system for understanding eukaryotic transcription.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Epigenetics and Gene Regulation
